description: If the IdentityProviderType of a file transfer protocol-enabled server is AWS_DIRECTORY_SERVICE or API_Gateway, tests whether your identity provider is set up successfully. We highly recommend that you call this operation to test your authentication method as soon as you create your server. By doing so, you can troubleshoot issues with the identity provider integration to ensure that your users can successfully use the service. The ServerId and UserName parameters are required. The ServerProtocol, SourceIp, and UserPassword are all optional. Note the following:

parameters.name: ServerId
parameters.description: A system-assigned identifier for a specific server. That server's user authentication method is tested with a user name and password.

parameters.name: ServerProtocol
parameters.description: The type of file transfer protocol to be tested. The available protocols are: Secure Shell (SSH) File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) File Transfer Protocol Secure (FTPS) File Transfer Protocol (FTP) Applicability Statement 2 (AS2)

parameters.name: UserName
parameters.description: The name of the account to be tested.

nested_items.name: Response
nested_items.description: The response that is returned from your API Gateway or your Lambda function.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The HTTP status code that is the response from your API Gateway or your Lambda function.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A message that indicates whether the test was successful or not.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The endpoint of the service used to authenticate a user.
